Do you bulls know what happens when a descending triangle is confirmed? Keep eviscerating yourself in attempts to catch that falling knife.

$SOXL Last February this portfolio was 180k, now it's 38k and I added 6k to it this year as a retirement contribution. Yeah, thanks Joe you F*ck, you're doing a bang up job you cucksocker. $NIO , $NVDA , $LABU , $BULZ

⭐️ ⭐️ Profits for today: $475.85 ⭐️ ⭐️ 

Took it very easy today given that it was Friday and I like to finish Friday’s green. Main winners today were $NVDA and $HOUR with $150s in profit each. The rest were plays for around $10-$40 that added up. One reason I realize why it’s harder for me to make money when SPY goes one direction is because I don’t trade with the trend. I prefer spy going up and down all day 😅, those days are easier for me to short and go long. I need to learn how to trade with the trend better imo. Hope you all had a good day and banked 😀. Exceeded expectations this week and was only $750 away from the 45k mark. The goal was to get to 45k by next Friday if I had daily $500 days. Could’ve reached this mark on Monday, however I had to withdraw some money today to pay my credit card. Having said, even with the withdrawal if I can manage 500 days everyday next week I’ll barely make it past 45k 😁 🍀. Have a good evening everyone 😀
$NVDA blink your eye and it will be at $230 next week

$NVDA Sadly, the only hope for a rebound is technical and god-willing, a massive enormous earnings beat. 
 
But besides that, there is absolutely zero macro tailwinds to support a return to the good old days. 
 
Nothing but headwinds - ukraine, rates, consumer sentiment, etc. 
 
Honestly, this sucks.

$SPY $UVXY $GOOGL $DIA $NVDA The US is going to enter a recession Q2 and Q3 people...it's clear as day. Higher rates means lower spending by companies and consumers, which means the economy is going to slow or see a decline.  
 
The market was insanely inflated due to all the money printing. If JP hadn't raised the rates the market bubble would have only worsened. Commodity prices would have kept climbing higher; we would be paying $8 for a gallon of milk/gasoline lmao. What he did was only healthy for the US economy in the long run. 
 
Those of you trying to catch a falling knife, buying the dip before close today, will see red Monday. The market will take a while to recover from this. It isn't going to be like March of 2020 where the market exploded higher months after the beginning of the pandemic. The pandemic was an artificial blow to the economy. This time around, inflation is rampant, and it will takes months if not years to recover from this bubble pop. Do not go long yet.
$SOXL Go Brandon , you azzhole. $LABU , $BULZ , $NVDA , $FB
